title: Authors and Citation
text: Benjamin Skov Kaas-Hansen. Author, maintainer. Anders Granholm. Author. Aksel Karl Georg Jensen. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kaas-Hansen BS, Jensen AKG, Granholm (2023). hrqolr: R package simulating health-related quality life trajectories. https://inceptdk.github.io/hrqolr/
code: @Manual{,   title = {{hrqolr}: an R package for simulating health-related quality of life trajectories},   author = {Benjamin Skov Kaas-Hansen and Aksel Karl Georg Jensen and Anders Granholm},   year = {2023},   url = {https://inceptdk.github.io/hrqolr/}, }

what: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: Package simulating two-arm randomised clinical trials temporal trajectories health-related quality life (HRQoL) outcome quantifies effect sizes single-sampled HRQoL values end follow-area trajectories. Developed part INCEPT (Intensive Care Platform Trial) project (https://incept.dk/), primarily supported grant Sygeforsikringen “danmark” (https://www.sygeforsikring.dk/).

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: Website - stand-alone website full package documentation Health-related quality life trajectories critical illness: protocol Monte Carlo simulation study - article Acta Anaesthesiologica Scandinavica outlining first scientific study use hrqolr

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: hrqolr isn’t CRAN yet can installed GitHub remotes package installed: can also install development version directly GitHub. requires remotes-package installed. development version may contain additional features yet available stable CRAN version, may unstable lack documentation.

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: First, load package: –, activate cache. optional highly recommended. hrqolr built simulate many scenarios, define single scenario use .call give list elements named arguments function:
code: library(hrqolr) #> Loading 'hrqolr' package v0.0.9000. #> For help, run 'help("hrqolr")' or check out https://inceptdk.github.io/hrqolr/. #> Consider running 'cache_hrqolr()' for faster simulations. If you have enough RAM, increasing the cache size might speed up things even more;  #> run '?cache_hrqolr' for details. cache_hrqolr() scenario <- list(     n_trials = 100L,     n_patients_per_arm = 100L,     sampling_frequency = 14L,     n_patients_ground_truth = 1000L,     n_example_trajectories_per_arm = 100L,          arms = c("A", "B"),     index_hrqol = c(A = 0.0, B = 0.0),     first_hrqol = c(A = 0.1, B = 0.1),     final_hrqol = c(A = 0.8, B = 0.7),     acceleration_hrqol = c(A = 0.1, B = 0.0),          mortality = c(A = 0.4, B = 0.4),     mortality_dampening = c(A = 0.0, B = 0.0),     mortality_trajectory_shape = c(A = "exp_decay", B = "exp_decay"),     prop_mortality_benefitters = c(A = 0.0, B = 0.0),     n_digits = 3 )  example_trajs <- do.call(sample_example_trajectories, scenario) example_trajs #> $arm_level #>      arm          x         y #>   1:   A   0.000000 0.0000000 #>   2:   A   5.000000 0.1100000 #>   3:   A   5.006211 0.1100609 #>   4:   A   5.017999 0.1102155 #>   5:   A   5.035294 0.1104622 #>  ---                          #> 594:   B 186.604774 0.7000000 #> 595:   B 186.762172 0.7000000 #> 596:   B 186.880937 0.7000000 #> 597:   B 186.960426 0.7000000 #> 598:   B 187.000000 0.7000000 #>  #> $patient_level #>       arm  id   x         y #>    1:   A   1   0 0.0000000 #>    2:   A   1   9 0.1210000 #>    3:   A   1  10 0.0000000 #>    4:   A   2   0 0.0000000 #>    5:   A   2  50 0.0820000 #>   ---                       #> 2252:   B 200 133 0.7223143 #> 2253:   B 200 147 0.7280000 #> 2254:   B 200 161 0.7310000 #> 2255:   B 200 175 0.7310000 #> 2256:   B 200 189 0.7310000 #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "hrqolr_trajectories" "list"

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: might also want break apart trajectories arms. Note ribbons become bit wonky end follow-increasingly observations, may low , e.g., mortality benefitters still alive.  scenario specification can, , used simulate desired number trials:

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: use GitHub issue tracker bug/issue reports proposals enhancements.

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: welcome contributions directly code improve performance well new functionality. latter, please first explain motivate issue. Changes code base follow steps: Fork repository Make branch appropriate name fork Implement changes fork, make sure passes R CMD check (neither errors, warnings, notes) add bullet top NEWS.md short description change, GitHub handle id pull request implementing change (check NEWS.md file see formatting) Create pull request dev branch adaptr

title: Simulator of health-related quality of life trajectories
text: using hrqolr, please consider citing :
code: citation(package = "hrqolr") #> To cite package 'hrqolr' in publications use: #>  #>   Kaas-Hansen BS, Jensen AKG, Granholm A (2023). hrqolr: an R package #>   for simulating health-related quality of life trajectories. #>   https://inceptdk.github.io/hrqolr/ #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {{hrqolr}: an R package for simulating health-related quality of life trajectories}, #>     author = {Benjamin Skov Kaas-Hansen and Aksel Karl Georg Jensen and Anders Granholm}, #>     year = {2023}, #>     url = {https://inceptdk.github.io/hrqolr/}, #>   }

title: Bootstrap confidence intervals and p values — bootstrap_estimates
text: vals numeric vector grps character vector, allowed values "ctrl" "actv" used slice x two vectors values compared. na_replacement scalar (NULL), NULL missing values removed. Otherwise, missing values replaced value na_replacement n_samples scalar, number bootstrap samples alpha numeric, 1.0 - confidence_level

title: Bootstrap confidence intervals and p values — bootstrap_estimates
text: four-element vector point estimate, p value confidence internal

title: Bootstrap mean differences — bootstrap_mean_diffs
Bootstrap mean differences — bootstrap_mean_diffs
text: vals numeric vector values observations grps int vector group assignments values vals parameter. Assumes: 0 = actv, 1 = ctrl. B int, number bootstrap samples (default = 2000) fixed_seed int, seed used pseudo-random number generation

title: Bootstrap mean differences — bootstrap_mean_diffs
text: bootstrap samples mean difference group assignment, numeric vector.

title: Caching of hrqolr functions — cache_hrqolr
text: TODO: Later , may implement memoisation logic lighter memoise.

title: Caching of hrqolr functions — cache_hrqolr
code: cache_hrqolr(   max_size = 1 * 1024^3,   max_age = Inf,   max_n = Inf,   logfile = NULL,   evict = "lru" )  clear_hrqolr_cache()  remove_hrqolr_cache()

title: Caching of hrqolr functions — cache_hrqolr
text: max_size Maximum size cache, bytes. cache exceeds size, cached objects removed according value evict. Use Inf size limit. default 512 megabytes. max_age Maximum age files cache evicted, seconds. Use Inf age limit. max_n Maximum number objects cache. number objects exceeds value, cached objects removed according value evict. Use Inf limit number items. logfile optional filename connection object logging information written. log console, use stderr() stdout(). evict eviction policy use decide objects removed cache pruning occurs. Currently, "lru" "fifo" supported.

title: Caching of hrqolr functions — cache_hrqolr
text: NULL, functions called side effects: caching (clearing caches) select hrqolr functions.

what: Compute outcome estimates for a given patient — compute_estimates
title: Compute outcome estimates for a given patient — compute_estimates
text: Compute outcome estimates given patient

title: Compute outcome estimates for a given patient — compute_estimates
code: compute_estimates(   t_icu_discharge,   t_death,   first_hrqol_patient,   is_mortality_benefitter,   acceleration_hrqol,   index_hrqol_arm,   first_hrqol_arm,   final_hrqol_arm,   mortality_trajectory_shape,   mortality_dampening,   sampling_frequency = 14L,   n_digits = 2 )

title: Compute outcome estimates for a given patient — compute_estimates
text: t_icu_discharge scalar, time ICU discharge t_death numeric scalar, time death. NA represent administrative censoring (.e., patient still alive end follow-) first_hrqol_patient scalar, HRQoL value ICU discharge patient is_mortality_benefitter logical, patient mortality benefitters? Defaults FALSE. acceleration_hrqol scalar, acceleration HRQoL improvement compared baseline trajectory first_hrqol_arm scalar, HRQoL ICU discharge (arm level) final_hrqol_arm scalar HRQoL end follow-(arm level) mortality_trajectory_shape named character vector, valid values : "exp_decay" (default), "linear", "constant", "reflected_exp_decay". Can differ across arms. mortality_dampening named numeric vector, dampening effect HRQoL ICU discharge patients die end follow-sampling_frequency int, span samplings patients elements. n_digits int, number digits HRQoL values. digits yield greater precision also cause longer run-times.

title: Compute outcome estimates for a given patient — compute_estimates
text: six-element named numeric vector single-sampled HRQoL end follow-area HRQoL trajectory primary two secondary analyses.

Defaults FALSE. mortality_trajectory_shape named character vector, valid values : "exp_decay" (default), "linear", "constant", "reflected_exp_decay". Can differ across arms. mortality_dampening named numeric vector, dampening effect HRQoL ICU discharge patients die end follow-sampling_frequency int, span samplings patients elements. n_digits int, number digits HRQoL values. digits yield greater precision also cause longer run-times.

title: Compute p values and confidence intervals a.m. Games Howell — games_howell_test

title: Compute p values and confidence intervals a.m. Games Howell — games_howell_test
text: data.table one row per pairwise comparison six columns: comparator, target, estimate (= mean difference), p value well lower upper bounds confidence interval corresponding alpha parameter.

title: Sample example trajectories — sample_example_trajectories
text: arms character vector names arms. Must match names named vectors . n_example_trajectories_per_arm int, number example trajectories include returned object index_hrqol named numeric vector, HRQoL index (= enrolment) first_hrqol named numeric vector, HRQoL ICU discharge arm final_hrqol named numeric vector, HRQoL end follow-arm sampling_frequency int, span samplings patients elements. acceleration_hrqol named numeric vector, relative acceleration HRQoL improvement arm mortality named numeric vector [0, 1], mortality end follow-, arm prop_mortality_benefitters named numeric vector [0, 1], proportion patients arm -called mortality benefitters. mortality_trajectory_shape named character vector, valid values : "exp_decay" (default), "linear", "constant", "reflected_exp_decay". Can differ across arms. mortality_dampening named numeric vector, dampening effect HRQoL ICU discharge patients die end follow-n_digits int, number digits HRQoL values. digits yield greater precision also cause longer run-times. seed int, optional seed reproducible pseudo-random number generation. Defaults deterministic value based arguments given (ensuring reproducibility default). valid_hrqol_range two-element numeric vector, lower upper bounds valid HRQoL values. default (c(-0.757, 1.0)) corresponds Danish EQ-5D-5L index values. ... used

title: Simulate trials — simulate_trials
text: key user-facing function simulating trials.

title: Simulate trials — simulate_trials
code: simulate_trials(   n_trials = 100L,   n_patients_per_arm = 100L,   sampling_frequency = 14L,   n_patients_ground_truth = 1000L,   n_example_trajectories_per_arm = 50L,   arms = c("A", "B"),   index_hrqol = c(A = 0, B = 0),   first_hrqol = c(A = 0.1, B = 0.1),   final_hrqol = c(A = 0.75, B = 0.75),   acceleration_hrqol = c(A = 0, B = 0),   mortality = c(A = 0.4, B = 0.4),   mortality_dampening = c(A = 0, B = 0.7),   mortality_trajectory_shape = c(A = "exp_decay", B = "exp_decay"),   prop_mortality_benefitters = c(A = 0, B = 0),   test_fun = welch_t_test,   verbose = TRUE,   n_digits = 2,   seed = NULL,   valid_hrqol_range = c(-0.757, 1),   alpha = 0.05,   ... )

title: Simulate trials — simulate_trials
text: n_trials int scalar vector. vector, simulations run batches size given n_patients_per_arm int scalar sampling_frequency int, span samplings patients elements. n_patients_ground_truth int, many patients (per arm) use estimating ground truth n_example_trajectories_per_arm int, number example trajectories include returned object arms character vector names arms. Must match names named vectors . index_hrqol named numeric vector, HRQoL index (= enrolment) first_hrqol named numeric vector, HRQoL ICU discharge arm final_hrqol named numeric vector, HRQoL end follow-arm acceleration_hrqol named numeric vector, relative acceleration HRQoL improvement arm mortality named numeric vector [0, 1], mortality end follow-, arm mortality_dampening named numeric vector, dampening effect HRQoL ICU discharge patients die end follow-mortality_trajectory_shape named character vector, valid values : "exp_decay" (default), "linear", "constant", "reflected_exp_decay". Can differ across arms. prop_mortality_benefitters named numeric vector [0, 1], proportion patients arm -called mortality benefitters. test_fun function used compare estimates. default welch_t_test (built hrqolr). Note function handle number arms provided. See Details . verbose logical, function give progress timestamped updates? Default: TRUE n_digits int, number digits HRQoL values. digits yield greater precision also cause longer run-times. seed int, optional seed reproducible pseudo-random number generation. Defaults deterministic value based arguments given (ensuring reproducibility default). valid_hrqol_range two-element numeric vector, lower upper bounds valid HRQoL values. default (c(-0.757, 1.0)) corresponds Danish EQ-5D-5L index values. alpha scalar [0, 1], desired type 1 error rate used comparing HRQoL arms. ..., used

title: Simulate trials — simulate_trials
text: object class hrqolr_results, specialised list four elements: summary statistics arm, comparisons (incl. performance metrics), seed elapsed time.
